Interface ec.id.ID

Subinterfaces:
ReachableID
Implementing Classes:
StringID
public abstract interface ID
Root interface for basic identity equality. Any class that is an implementor of this interface is agreeing to provide 'EQ' equality testing for its instances. That is, it is agreeing to guarantee (somehow) that its instances are globally unique, and that the equals and hashCode tests this interface defines will only be satisfied if the objects identify the same object instance, even if the object 'lives' on another process.

Author:
Scott B. Lewis, slewis@communities.com
See Also:
ECID

          Basic EQ equality testing.

Method Detail

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
Basic EQ equality testing. Implementers of this interface must guarantee that this equals test really does satisfy EQ (global uniqueness).
Parameters:
obj - the Object to compare against
Returns:
true if the given obj is 'EQ' with the implementer of this interface. False if obj is null, of the wrong type, or not EQ equals with the implementer of this interface.
Overrides:
equals in class Object

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Provide hashcode for object. This should return some integer value that is globally unique.
Returns:
int that is globally unique for all instances of the implementing class
Overrides:
hashCode in class Object

preceeds

public boolean preceeds(Object other)
Determine if one ID preceeds another. This allows client code that uses instances of classes that implement IDs to be able to depend upon some ordering.
Parameters:
other - another ID implementer object
Returns:
true if this Object is non-null and of the right type, and should preceed other in an ordering. False otherwise.
